area_name: New Don Wall (aka Upper Hurd Basin)

content.description: This is the toprope line to furthest right top anchors. It has positive holds.
This is the hardest bolted line at the crag with a thin crux up high that's a bit slippery but may improve with use. Venturing a bit off line may ease the crux if you choose.
content.protection:
8 bolts to anchors shared with

Route 6

.
content.location: This is the furthest right bolted line.

content.description: This climb consists of face climbing, not real steep but holds are small and a bit dirty.  This crux is near the bottom (bolt 1 to bolt 3).
content.protection:
8 bolts plus top anchors, which are shared with

Route 7

.
content.location: It is the second bolted line from the right.

content.description: This route has about 40 feet of ~5.4 terrain that can be trad protected then 20 feet of 5.6 at the top with three bolts to top anchors. So, it is best to TR this route if you don't bring trad gear.
content.protection: Curiously and partially bolted, with 3 bolts up high plus anchors. Some trad potential down low, but not great. Probably best done on TR.
content.location: This lies in the middle of the crag in the space between the 4 bolt lines to the left and 2 bolt lines to the right.

content.description: This has nice and fairly consistent climbing bottom to top.
content.location: It is the 4th bolted line from the left.

content.description: This has a steep start with positive holds. It is fairly consistent in difficulty.
content.protection:
6 bolts.  Option at top to anchors for either

R1

&

R2

or for

R4

.
content.location: It is the third route from the left.

content.description: This has a steep start with positive holds.
content.protection:
6 bolts plus top anchors shared with

R1

.
content.location: It is the second route from left.

content.description: This is a short, one-move wonder route. It has a bouldery crux right off the ground, followed by easy climbing.
content.protection:
3 bolts plus top anchors shared with

R2

.
content.location: This is the first route on left (north) end of crag. Start behind a tree up the steep hill left of the other routes.

pathTokens: New Don Wall (aka Upper Hurd Basin)
